title: New Chief of Staff appointed to Sri Lanka Army
body_lines: Major General Jagath Kodithuwakku, the current Deputy Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Army, has been appointed the new Chief of Staff of the Army.
His new appointment will be effective from tomorrow (June 08).
Army Commander Lieutenant General Vikum Liyanage handed over the letter of appointment to Major General Kodithuwakku this afternoon (June 07) at the Commander’s office.

Major General Kodithuwakku, who served as the Commander Security Forces Jaffna before he took office as the Deputy Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Army on 12 December 2021, has also held many key appointments in the Army.
He is also the Colonel of the Regiment, Sri Lanka Light Infantry.
Major General Jagath Kodituwakku will take office as the 60th Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Army tomorrow.
